description:
When port_security_enabled = False its not possible to boot instance with security group.
The instance is in "ERROR" state .
The log display unclear error message :

Version : Newton -10

[root@controller-0 ~]# rpm -qa |grep neutron

title: unclear error message while booting VM with security group when port_security_enabled=false

comments.content:
When port_security_enabled = False its not possible to boot instance with security group.
The instance is in "ERROR" state .
The log display unclear error message : 
 

[root@controller-0 ~]# rpm -qa |grep neutron
openstack-neutron-lbaas-9.1.0-1.el7ost.noarch

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ekuris

comments.content: How can we reproduce the issue? Could you elaborate?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ichihara-hirofumi

comments.content:
Steps to reproduce :
1. Create network with disable port_security --> port_security_enabled = False
2. try to boot VM 
3. The is in error state  , the reason is because it try to create the vm with "default" security group when port_security_enabled = False
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ekuris

comments.content:
@Eran,
I can not find the `port_security_enabled` option.
# grep -rn "port_security_enabled" /etc/

/etc/neutron/policy.json:76:    "create_port:port_security_enabled": "rule:context_is_advsvc or rule:admin_or_network_owner",
/etc/neutron/policy.json:91:    "update_port:port_security_enabled": "rule:context_is_advsvc or rule:admin_or_network_owner",
/etc/openstack-dashboard/neutron_policy.json:76:    "create_port:port_security_enabled": "rule:context_is_advsvc or rule:admin_or_network_owner",
/etc/openstack-dashboard/neutron_policy.json:91:    "update_port:port_security_enabled": "rule:context_is_advsvc or rule:admin_or_network_owner",

The version i used as below:
# rpm -qa | grep neutron
openstack-neutron-linuxbridge-9.1.1-1.el7.noarch
python2-neutronclient-6.0.0-1.el7.noarch
python-neutron-lib-0.4.0-1.el7.noarch
openstack-neutron-common-9.1.1-1.el7.noarch
openstack-neutron-9.1.1-1.el7.noarch
python-neutron-9.1.1-1.el7.noarch
openstack-neutron-ml2-9.1.1-1.el7.noarch
# rpm -qa | grep nova
python2-novaclient-6.0.0-1.el7.noarch
python-nova-14.0.2-1.el7.noarch
openstack-nova-api-14.0.2-1.el7.noarch
openstack-nova-common-14.0.2-1.el7.noarch
openstack-nova-console-14.0.2-1.el7.noarch
openstack-nova-conductor-14.0.2-1.el7.noarch
openstack-nova-novncproxy-14.0.2-1.el7.noarch
openstack-nova-scheduler-14.0.2-1.el7.noarch
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~eric-xie

comments.content: I see. You mean that you want to boot VM with security group although the network of VM is port_security_enabled=False, right? However, neutron doesn't allow so. In the situation, nova compute log says "SecurityGroupCannotBeApplied: Network requires port_security_enabled and subnet associated in order to apply security groups." as well.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ichihara-hirofumi

comments.content:
@hirofumi ,

No I meant that when network created with port_security_enabled=False 
and you boot vm (when booting vm with port_security_enabled=False there is no Security group that assign to VM )
stack@undercloud-0 ~]$ neutron net-show public
+---------------------------+--------------------------------------+
| Field                     | Value                                |
+---------------------------+--------------------------------------+
| admin_state_up            | True                                 |
| availability_zone_hints   |                                      |
| availability_zones        | nova                                 |
| created_at                | 2017-02-22T09:28:56Z                 |
| description               |                                      |
| id                        | 509a2236-e115-4c58-888c-826605541f96 |
| ipv4_address_scope        |                                      |
| ipv6_address_scope        |                                      |
| is_default                | False                                |
| mtu                       | 1496                                 |
| name                      | public                               |
| port_security_enabled     | False                               


steps to reproduce -
1. neutron net-create net-64-2 --port_security_enabled false
2. neutron subnet-create net-64-2 10.0.5.0/24 --name subnet_4 --enable_dhcp true
3. neutron router-create Router_eNet
4. neutron router-interface-add Router_eNet  dd073541-b444-4ab6-8187-346d7a8eb96a
5. neutron router-gateway-set Router_eNet 25df8c01-0632-4b49-ac8c-31d0155bfb0e
6. nova boot --flavor 3 --image rhel VM1 --nic net-id=551f3ab9-2292-4d43-b8bd-b7bd59951799
7. neutron port-show 104ab04f-3b1f-408e-bee0-10ba0d6dab35 |grep security
verify  port_security_enabled = False
8. connectivity check from qrouter to VM1 
ip net exec qrouter-5d10b101-4bc5-4261-aa3d-9c192e85ee06 ping 10.0.5.4
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ekuris

comments.content: Is there a suggestion for a better error message? My understanding was that port security wasn't optional any more.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague

comments.content: "remove Security group when   port_security_enabled = False"  or something like that.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ekuris

comments.content: [Expired for OpenStack Compute (nova) because there has been no activity for 60 days.]
